description: Borrowed from Latin resectus, past participle of resecare (“to cut off”), formed in turn from re- + secare (“to cut”).

verbs.description: resect (third-person singular simple present resects, present participle resecting, simple past and past participle resected)

entries.meaning: (surgery, transitive) To remove (some part of an organ or structure) by surgical means.
examples: The tumor was resected after chemotherapy.
